meanings.definition: One who tempers or moderates something.
meanings.sent1: The temperer of the meeting ensured everyone had a chance to speak.
meanings.sent2: As a temperer of emotions, she always knew how to calm others down.
meanings.sent3: The temperer of the spicy chili added just the right amount of heat.
meanings.sent4: She was like a skilled temperer, balancing the flavors in the dish perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The temperer of the orchestra harmonized the different instruments beautifully.

meanings.definition: A person who adjusts or balances something.
meanings.sent1: The temperer of the scales made sure they were always accurate.
meanings.sent2: He was known as the temperer of conflicts in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The temperer of the seesaw made sure both sides were equal.
meanings.sent4: Like a skilled temperer, he found the perfect balance between work and play.
meanings.sent5: The temperer of the budget carefully allocated funds to different departments.

meanings.definition: A tool or device used for tempering or adjusting.
meanings.sent1: The chef used a temperer to control the temperature of the chocolate.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic reached for the temperer to fine-tune the engine.
meanings.sent3: The temperer in the workshop helped in crafting precise metal pieces.
meanings.sent4: Like a magic wand, the temperer transformed the raw material into a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The temperer in the factory ensured the machines were running smoothly.
